meanings.definition: To surpass in sparkling or shining.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks outsparkled the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outsparkled the sun on a bright summer day.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's glittery shoes outsparkled the disco ball at the party.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outsparkled all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent5: The dew on the morning grass outsparkled the diamond with its glistening beauty.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The new LED lights outsparkled the old incandescent bulbs.
meanings.sent2: His talent for storytelling outsparkled all the other performers.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape outsparkled even the brightest stars in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence outsparkled her classmates during the science fair.
meanings.sent5: The grand fireworks display outsparkled the city lights, lighting up the night sky.
